com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.common

Class DirectoryHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.perftools.common.DirectoryHandler

  • public class DirectoryHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the source directory handler for the UPA consumer application. It provides methods for sending the source directory request to a provider and processing the response. Methods for setting the service name, getting the service information, and closing a source directory stream are also provided.

      • isRequestedServiceUp

        public boolean isRequestedServiceUp()

        true if service requested by application is up, false if not.

      • serviceInfo

        public com.thomsonreuters.upa.valueadd.domainrep.rdm.directory.Service serviceInfo()
        Returns:
        service info associated with the service name requested by application.

      • getRequest

        public com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.TransportBuffer getRequest(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Channel channel,
                                                                   com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Sends a source directory request to a channel. This consists of getting a message buffer, encoding the source directory request, and sending the source directory request to the server.

      • processResponse

        public int processResponse(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Channel chnl,
                           com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec.Msg msg,
                           com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec.DecodeIterator dIter,
                           com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Processes a source directory response. This consists of looking at the msg class and decoding message into corresponding RDM directory message. After decoding, service status state (up or down) is updated from a refresh or update message for a requested service.
        Parameters:
        chnl - - The channel of the response msg - The partially decoded message
        dIter - - The decode iterator

      • getClose

        public com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.TransportBuffer getClose(com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Channel channel,
                                                                 com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport.Error error)
        Close the source directory stream.
